rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Primitive recursive functions
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A function shall be called a number theoretic function, if its variables are non-negative integers, and its values are non-negative integers. A number theoretic function shall be called primitive recursive if it can be obtained from the initial functions I, II, III by a finite number of substitutions and primitive recursions. In constructing the primitive recursive functions the following initial functions and definition schemes shall be used.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics
